alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 10:41PM EDT until September 04 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1039 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain had diminished across the advisory area; however, excessive runoff from previous heavy rainfall will continue to cause minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Osborn, Galveston, Grethel, Craynor, Boldman, Beaver, Aluba, Coal Run, Harold, Buckhorn Hollow, Betsy Layne, Justell, Ligon and Melvin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
